Package se.arkalix.util.concurrent

Class FutureScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.arkalix.util.concurrent.FutureScheduler
  • public final class FutureScheduler
extends java.lang.Object
    A scheduler useful for asynchronous execution of Futures.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefault

        public static FutureScheduler getDefault()
        Acquires a reference to the lazily initialized default scheduler.

        If no scheduler exists when this method is called, a new such with twice as many pooled threads as available CPU cores is created and returned. Otherwise the existing instance is returned immediately.

        The default scheduler is used automatically by Kalix classes that need a scheduler to operate, but are not explicitly assigned any such when instantiated. The default scheduler differs from other schedulers in that it is automatically assigned its own shutdown hook. This means that if the application is told to terminate via System.exit(int) or an external interrupt, the default scheduler starts an orderly shutdown with a deadline of 5 seconds. This behavior can be adjusted by setting a default scheduler before any Kalix class gets a chance to call this method.

        Returns:
        Default scheduler instance.
        See Also:
        setDefault(FutureScheduler), setDefaultWithShutdownHook(FutureScheduler, Duration)

      • setDefault

        public static void setDefault​(FutureScheduler scheduler)
        Sets default scheduler.

        The default scheduler is used automatically by Kalix classes that need a scheduler to operate, but are not explicitly assigned any such when instantiated.

        This particular method sets the default scheduler without assigning it a shutdown hook. This means that the caller becomes responsible for ensuring that the scheduler is shut down when no longer in use. Use setDefaultWithShutdownHook(FutureScheduler, Duration) if wanting a shutdown hook to be set.

        Parameters:
        scheduler - Scheduler to use as default scheduler.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a default scheduler has already been set.
        See Also:
        getDefault()

      • setDefaultWithShutdownHook

        public static void setDefaultWithShutdownHook​(FutureScheduler scheduler,
                                              java.time.Duration timeout)
        Sets default scheduler and assigns it a shutdown hook.

        The default scheduler is used automatically by Kalix classes that need a scheduler to operate, but are not explicitly assigned any such when instantiated.

        This particular method sets the default scheduler and assigns it a shutdown hook. When triggered, the default scheduler's shutdown(Duration) method is invoked with the provided timeout. Use setDefault(FutureScheduler) if not wanting a shutdown hook to be set.

        Parameters:
        scheduler - Scheduler to use as default scheduler.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If a default scheduler has already been set.
        See Also:
        getDefault()

      • create

        public static FutureScheduler create()
        Returns:
        New Scheduler with a thread pool containing twice as many threads as available system CPU cores.

      • withNThreads

        Parameters:
        nThreads - Number of threads to create for thread pool.
        Returns:
        New Scheduler with a thread pool containing nThreads threads.

      • withThreadFactory

        public static FutureScheduler withThreadFactory​(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threadFactory)
        Parameters:
        threadFactory - Factory to use for creating new threads.
        Returns:
        New Scheduler using given threadFactory with a thread pool containing twice as many threads as available system CPU cores.

      • withThreadFactoryAndNThreads

        public static FutureScheduler withThreadFactoryAndNThreads​(java.util.concurrent.ThreadFactory threadFactory,
                                                           int nThreads)
        Parameters:
        threadFactory - Factory to use for creating new threads.
        nThreads - Number of threads to create for thread pool.
        Returns:
        New Scheduler using given threadFactory with a thread pool containing nThreads threads.

      • addShutdownListener

        public boolean addShutdownListener​(FutureSchedulerShutdownListener listener)
        Adds listener to be notified when this scheduler shuts down.

        The event is guaranteed to only ever occur once during the life of every FutureScheduler, and occurs right when shutdown begins. This means that the shutdown listener is able to schedule tasks for a little while before the thread pool is forcibly emptied.

        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to be notified.
        Returns:
        true only if listener was not already registered for receiving shutdown events.

      • removeShutdownListener

        public boolean removeShutdownListener​(FutureSchedulerShutdownListener listener)
        Removes scheduler shutdown listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - Listener to no longer be notified when this scheduler shuts down.
        Returns:
        true only if listener was registered, and now no longer is registered, for receiving shutdown events.

      • scheduleAtFixedRate

        public Future<?> scheduleAtFixedRate​(java.lang.Runnable command,
                                     java.time.Duration delay,
                                     java.time.Duration rate)
        Schedules given command for execution after given delay, after which it is executed repeatedly at given rate.

        There are three ways of stopping the execution of given command:

        1. Calling Future.cancel(boolean) on the returned Future.
        2. Shutting down the Scheduler.
        3. Throwing an exception from inside the command, which is then propagated to the returned Future.
        Parameters:
        command - Command to execute.
        Returns:
        Future that completes only if (1) the Scheduler is terminated, or (2) if command throws an exception.

      • scheduleWithFixedDelay

        public Future<?> scheduleWithFixedDelay​(java.lang.Runnable command,
                                        java.time.Duration delay,
                                        java.time.Duration rate)
        Schedules given command for execution after given delay added to given rate, after which it is executed repeatedly at given rate.

        There are three ways of stopping the execution of given command:

        1. Calling Future.cancel(boolean) on the returned Future.
        2. Shutting down the Scheduler.
        3. Throwing an exception from inside the command, which is then propagated to the returned Future.
        Parameters:
        command - Command to execute.
        Returns:
        Future that completes only if (1) the Scheduler is terminated, or (2) if command throws an exception.

      • shutdown

        public Future<?> shutdown​(java.time.Duration timeout)
        Waits for a brief moment before preventing new tasks from being added to the scheduler, which are allowed to execute no longer than the specified timeout before being forcefully terminated.
        Parameters:
        timeout - Time after which any lingering tasks will be terminated forcefully.
        Returns:
        Future completed after shutdown completion. If there are shutdown listeners and any of them throws an exception when notified about shutdown, the returned Future is failed, if not already, and any listener exceptions are added to the fault's list of suppressed exceptions.

      • isShuttingDown

        public boolean isShuttingDown()
        Returns:
        true only if this scheduler is in the process of, or already have, shut down.

      • eventLoopGroup

        public io.netty.channel.EventLoopGroup eventLoopGroup()
